item.title: 7-10 potholes and sunken road on Farmfield Road, 8th March
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 114 Farmfield Road, Up Hatherley
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Top layer of tarmac missing., 8th March
item.description:
Work across the junction of Chosen Way and Hucclecote Rd was done some months ago. Very quickly the top layer of tarmac began to break up and a couple of potholes formed. Work was done today, 8th March, and the potholes were filled. The missing top layer of tarmac was not fixed. The result is obviously going to be the repaired areas deteriorating quickly. Why not fix all faults at the same time?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 9b Hucclecote Road, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pirton Lane road surface unsafe approaching Morley Avenue, 8th March
item.description:
Road surface on Pirton Lane approaching Morley Avenue coming from Cheltenham Road East is un safe, drivers are dodging the unsafe surface which in turn could cause an accident and damaged to vehicles. This also puts pressure on cyclists who are also trying to dodge the un safe service. This part of the road needs resurfacing.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 51 Pirton Lane, Churchdown
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Edge of road has disappeared., 8th March
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 28 Cleeve Road, Gotherington

item.title: Very Big Pothole, 8th March
item.description:
This pothole is opposite another large pothole and you cannot pass this section of the road without the possibility of damage to your car

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Elkstone

item.title: A cluster of pot holes, 8th March
item.description:
There are a cluster of potholes as you come into Elkstone, they are getting worse. You have to drive slowly over them for fear of damaging your car.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Elkstone

item.title: Pothole in Tivoli Walk, 8th March
item.description:

item.title: Large Pot-hole, 7th March
item.description:
Just as you leave the motorway at J11 M5 southbound, there is a large pothole which was until recently covered by the road work bollards running on the right-hand lane exit markers. Smaller vehicles may just about avoid it, but larger ones I suspect will not.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): M5, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous pothole, 7th March
item.description:
Dangerous pothole because this is in a very narrow part of the road. I watched aCyclist nearly get knocked off their bike the other day because they swerved to avoid the pothole (otherwise they come off their bike if they went into it) , and the car on other side of road didn’t have enough room to respond to their diversionAnd had to brake urgently
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 119 Old Bath Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
